Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in Friendly City”
Reviews.Author: TinkerbellNotts
Reviews.Content: Just back from short stay in Berlin, wonderful city break made all the better by the accommodation. Friendly helpful staff, clean well appointed rooms, great facilities and good location. Will definately be back, soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth its price and more!”
Reviews.Author: Rezarta
Reviews.Content: Well located and priced downtown hotel. We stayed there for one weekend and were impressed with how much it offers for such a reasonable price. The hotel is perfectly located next to a red-line subway station which makes it very accessible. Few minutes walk and you are by the pedestrian cobble stone streets in Berlin. The rooms are well sized, some have a great view overlooking river Spree which in Fall was pictoresque. The breakfast is great too, with a lot to chose and the staff friendly and accomodating. For what you pay, it's well worth it and a lot more. I would stay anytime again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: snogaroonies
Reviews.Content: You couldn't beat this hotel for location, literally 10 seconds walk to the Markisches Museum underground line (U2 red)...and that's if you were dawdling! We stayed in an double apartment room which was huge! We were expecting a little kitchenette in the corner of the room, but what we got was literally a suite with a large sitting room and kitchen complete with microwave and dish washer. We didn't bother with the hotel breakfast - we stocked up with milk, cheeses and meats at the supermarket down the road and then ordered from reception freshly baked rolls and croissants to be delivered to our door. Who could ask for more! Admittedly the maid only cleans the room and changes the towels every other day, but we never put our towels out to be refreshed every day even when we have the option. The staff were extremely friendly, spoke brilliant English, and it was spotlessly clean! We ate in the restaurant two nights and had complimentary drinks and extra starter both times, and the food was gorgeous! A previous review had said that the hotel was a little out of the way for nightlife...this is true, but when you've been out sightseeing all day we certainly didn't have the energy. The lovely restored area of Nikolaiviertel with lots of great traditional bars and restaurants is only a 10 minute walk away, and if you haven't got the energy to walk that far and fancy something other than pork knuckle, the Indian across the road is superb too! I recommend the Punjabi/Maharaja Thalis...both fantastic value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for a break in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: jan55
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very comfortable. Staff were helpful and friendly. An excellent buffet breakfast. Right next to the underground station. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great city great hotel”
Reviews.Author: karenfrost
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel which was very clean and welcoming. Rooms were spotless and modern and had a kettle hairdryer, tv, mini bar, 2 easy chairs and a desk/dressing table. The mini bar price was very cheap for a 4* hotel. 70cl bottle of wine was only 11 euros. Beds were extremely comfortable. perhaps some nice toiletires would have improved it even more. They only offered the usual body wash/shampoo and a tablet of soap. Breakfast offered loads of choice. A small sample of what was on offer was cereal, fresh fruit, every kind of bread/roll imagineable, cold meats and cheeses, smoked salmon, eggs. bacon, sausage, strudels and pastries. One of the best hotel breakfasts that we have experienced. We got it included in our package price which by the way was only 70 Euros per room per night for bed and breakfast (early bird offer from hotel itself) The lobby area is small but impressive as it is open all the way to the top of the hotel (6 floors) and the rooms are off a gallery landing around it. The bar is in this lobby area and be warned is only open from 6pm onwards. Complimentary coffee seemed to be available in this area from breakfast time onwards but was never there when we arrived back from a day of sightseeing. Reception staff were exxtremely helpful and efficient. they soon brought us extra pillows and a towelling bathrobe on request. The wellness area is welcome at the end of a day of walking the city although not as impressive as it looks on the pics. It has a sauna and steam room but the inviting lookin jacuzzi is in fact a freezing cold plunge pool. This area was mixed so dont be suprised to find naked men and ladies around. The location is great. we transferred from schonefeld airport by s and u bahn within an hour. We also then walked to many major attractions from here such as the brandenburg gate checkpoint charlie, parliament buildings, berlin dom. There are bars and restaurants within a 5 min walk. Reception staff will direct you. We ate at the indian immediately over the road on our first night due to apalling weather and had a wonderful meal. We would definately return to this hotel again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Berlin, loved Grosser...”
Reviews.Author: mobster21
Reviews.Content: We just turn back from beautiful Berlin... We stay for a 4 nights trip to the Grosser... Excellent service from the reservation to the reception... Excellent location... 10 meters from U Station... Very clean... and very nice building... Thanx for everything... We loved Berlin... We loved Grosser...

Reviews.Title: “40 years too late...”
Reviews.Author: kaaw
Reviews.Content: As said before, the hotel is in an excellent spot directly by the U-Bahn station. When you are arriving by public transport this is wonderfully convenient. That said, the grosser is one of many hotels in the immediate vicinity. The hotel itself is deceptive on entry. The expectations of a grand lobby created by previous reviews and the hotels own web site photos are shattered immediately when you walk into a small area with worn furniture. The effect of the half horse coming through the wall and the atrium feel when you look upwards makes the hotel seem grander than it actually is. The building is very art-deco in design and there are still hints of the original decor throughout. It's disappointing that the bedrooms have been sterilised by modern furnishings etc. The mirror in the bathroom is the only hint of what once was.... Staff excellent - good service at reception and an exceptionally quick responce from housekeeping to swap the cot (bet you can picture our 8 year old's face when he saw it!) for a single bed. Bar staff different every day - some more friendly than others. Breakfast provided from 6am (helpful for those with early flights) and was usual German fare with selection of meats, cheeses, breads, cereals etc. Hot food left something to be desired - if you want eggs go for the hard boilded, as opposed to the "soft" which were closer to raw than cooked. If you're down early you can choose from a fantastic selection of pastries also! Overall ok hotel, but nothing special. Probably stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Loved the Atrium”
Reviews.Author: CheshiremanUk
Reviews.Content: Excellent value 4 star 10 minutes walk from all the old eastern centre venues inc Alexanderplatz. Transport from the airport (Schonefeld) is about 40 mins and costs about £2. U bahn station is next to the hotel. Will definitely use this hotel again..

Reviews.Title: “Not that much in immediate area”
Reviews.Author: spark6791
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Christmas time (3 nights). The hotel itself, the rooms and presentation were immaculate - no complaints there!! Whilst the hotel is located relatively central, and is just meters from the underground system, it was a good 15min + walk to an area where we could take advantage of restaurants/bars. There was nothing immediately around the hotel - not even an off licence so we could buy our own drinks (given the hotel bar was shut during our stay). It would obviously depend on your own tastes whether this would pose a problem, and in summer, the walk would not have been an issue. Also- we were given a very bad steer by one of the receptionists who suggested we head to the area around Zoo station for "restaurants, bars and the like" .... there was nothing in that area, in fact we stopped at another hotel there and they told us to return to the area we had just come from as there was nothing bar KFC and Burger King! A good 2 hours wasted!! Renember, Berlin is NINE times the size of Paris - definitely read up on some suggested places to eat and drink before you leave!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for longer stays in the city”
Reviews.Author: DebTheGerman
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from a German hotel booking service. As my husband and myself were staying in Berlin for a week, we found it very convenient that this hotel offered apartments. The apartment we were given was excellent - very large with two televisions, two fridges, an enormous bathroom and lots of cupboard space. We were able to pre-order rolls, etc. from the bakery around the corner and these were left outside our apartment each morning,so we could have them for breakfast - typically German efficiency! Great location, quiet but easily accessible via U-bahn and bus to both the new city centre and the old one. Would not hesitate to use this hotel again and if you are staying for longer than a few nights, it is great to have the convenience of an apartment. There are also several supermarkets and a bakery within a few minutes walk, which we found very useful as you have a cooker, etc. in the small kitchen. Great place to visit for history buffs (as I am) is the STASI Headquarters on Normannenstrasse (U-bahn Frankfurter Allee) which has a wonderfully creepy feeling and many artifacts from the Cold War era. There is also a small 'cafe' where a local lady makes you tea/coffee and cakes while you watch a video of Berlin during the division of Germany. Not to be missed and you can even see the office of Erick Mielke, Chief of the Stasi.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Derag Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sfslinky
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. The hotel was extremely new, small and modern. Our room was very comfortable and the bathroom was a nice size. The breakfast buffet was a nice way to start the day. When we first arrived, there were gummy bears on our pillows. The best part is having the train station right across the street from the hotel, so it was extremely convenient and easy to get around all of Berlin. The beds were so comfortable and we always had a great night's sleep. There is a nice Indian restaurant across the street as well a great internet cafe another block away. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alana_Simpson
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is excellent: - great location, close to the u bahn station and within walking distance of all the main sites. - rooms are spacious and modern, with a great bathroom - staff are helpful and friendly - excellent value for money I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: leehill1507
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Derag Hotel Grosser Kurfuerst Hotel. One of the best attributes the hotel has is its location. Situated in Mitte, the entrance to Markisches Museum U-Bahn station on the U2 line is literally on the hotel doorstep (see candid photo of tube station entrance from our room). The station is two stops from Alexanderplatz, the first major station on the way into the city from Berlin Schoenfeld airport, and we were stood in our room only 1 hour after getting off the plane. The location gives an excellent base to explore the city and the hotel is easy walking distance to the Fernsehturm (TV Tower) and Nikolaiviertel. Stadmitte is only a couple of stops away on the U2 line, where you can shop at Galleries La Fayette and Postdamer Platz (a major commercial centre) is only 5 stops down the line. Check in was simple, and we had a large double room, which made the room rate of €70 per night seem a bit of a bargain. The room was nicely decorated / furnished and spotlessly clean. The batroom was large and modern and we had plenty of wardrobe space. The service was very efficient - We had a small problem with the safe when we arrived, and this was resolved within 5 minutes of us calling reception with minimum of fuss. The only real negative I could think of was the thin walls between rooms. Whilst this didn't cause too many problems, apart from the odd alarm clock and telephone ringing, I could imagine that if we'd have had noisy neighbours, we would not have been happy. I must say though I have experienced this problem in many hotels. We did not eat breakfast / dinner at the hotel so I can not comment on this. Overall a very nice hotel, and if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel for a short break in Berlin, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: Laurared
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at this excellent hotel and couldn't be happier. Excellent location in quiet, safe area with u-bahn station literally outside the door. Within walking distance of most major attractions or just hop on the U2 line a couple of stops to Prenzlauer Berg area which has lots of cool bars and restaurants. Our room was large, clean and comfortable and overlooked the canal. The staff were very friendly and professional and certainly wouldn't be out of place in a 5-star establishment. Just one piece of advice - check whether your rate includes breakfast, ours didn't (our fault as we didn't check with reception) and we were stung for 13 euro per person for a run-of-the-mill buffet on our first morning. Far better to avail of breakfast in one of the many cafes throughout the city which can easily be done for under 5 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and thoughtfulness”
Reviews.Author: Roy Little
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself have just returned from a weekend in Berlin at the wonderful DeragHotel, Grosser Kurfuest. Upon surfacing from the Berlin u-bahn, we were immediatley met by the sight of the the hotel (10 metres directly ahead of us). Particularly handy if it's raining, as you don't get a chance to get wet. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and helpful in getting us booked in and also with local knowledge of things to do, places to see etc. Upon reaching our room (which I had ordered flowers & chocolates for my wife) I also found a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine (on ice) had also been left. A very nice touch. The fittings in the room were of a high standard, and whilst not stunning, they did add to the character of the hotel. The hotel atrium is quite unusual for it's size and design. The breakfast area is on the first floor looking down into tho open plan atrium, as well is the rest of the hotel floors. Breakfast was excellent, with a large choice of things to eat, hot or cold. The hotel is well placed for many of the local sites, whilst being just far enough of the main streets so as to get a good night's sleep. Overall, an extremely good choice of hotel and great value. We would not hesitate in going again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 4 star property”
Reviews.Author: wimbrussel
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the Grosser Kurfürst was as enjoyable as the first, a year ago. Excellent location - calm yet only a 10 minute walk from the Museeninsel, with the U-Bahn in front of the hotel. Friendly staff at reception, bar and breakfast. Nice lobby with bar. Clean, quiet and comfortable rooms. The building is clear and bright. I will most definitely return here. Try and find a web deal (I booked via Hotel[-]): during Summer rooms can be booked for as low as 59 euro (and that includes breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Worth visiting”
Reviews.Author: Javanainen
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel perfectly situated for travellers who value easy transportation in the large town of Berlin. Not to forget the fact, that the hotel itself is very modern and fascinating as well. I stayed in Derag two nights in the beginning of August with my 13-year-old son. We got a nice deal via Hotels without breakfast. You shouldn't consider lower-star hotels, if you can get one like this with 72 euros per night in a comfortable room (+ commissions). While my son was resting and looking sport from TV, I could walk round the Nikolai area and Museum Island easily. Alex(anderplatz) was also within walking distance, if you prefer a bit activity and not only use metro. From this hotel, we could make use of both U- and S- lines easily. We chose two hotels during our stay in Berlin: 2 nights in the western areas and two in this hotel. The option for the use of internet (min. 15 minutes) was also excellent.

HotelInfo.Name: Derag Hotel Grosser Kurfuerst
HotelInfo.Address: Neue Rossstrasse 11-12, 10179 Berlin, Germany
